snippet: "American Idol" reverses a downward ratings trend.
abstract: "American Idol" reverses a downward ratings trend.
lead_paragraph: The ratings for "American Idol" reversed their course on Thursday night, growing slightly compared to last week, which provided Fox with a win for the night in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic coveted by advertisers. CBS drew the most viewers over all. An average of 17.9 million people watched "Idol," barely beating last week's total of 17.4 million but the show was also up 4 percent in the 18-to-49 category. Again, not a large gain, but a change from the downward trend that followed earlier episodes.
